sen.j: 新羅征討計画（しらぎせいとうけいかく）は飛鳥時代に計画された朝鮮半島への軍事行動。
sen.e: The Shiragi Seito Plan was a plan for military action in the Korean Peninsula during the Aska Period.
The plan to conquest Silla was a plan for military action in the Korean Peninsula during the Asuka period.
sen.cmt: スペル修正し、用語を変更しました。
sen.e: The plan to conquest Silla was a plan for military action in the Korean Peninsula during the Asuka period.

sen.j: 西暦562年、任那任那日本府が新羅によって滅ばされた。
sen.e: The Japanese Mimana Government in Mimana was taken over by Shiragi in 562 AD.
The Japanese Mimana Government was taken over by Silla in 562.
sen.cmt: 原文には (任那任那日本府) とありますが、リンク先の単語が抽出されるバグのようですので、（任那日本府）として訳出しています。
sen.e: The Japanese Mimana Government was taken over by Silla in 562.

sen.j: これを回復するための「征討軍」が推古天皇に計画実行された。
sen.e: In order to reestablish the Japanese Mimana Government, Emperor Suiko planned and executed a "Sitogun" (an expeditionary force).
In order to reestablish the Japanese Mimana Government, Emperor Suiko planned and executed a 'Seitogun' (an expeditionary force).
In order to reestablish the Japanese Mimana Government, Emperor Suiko planned and executed a 'Seitogun' (an expeditionary force).

sen.j: 1度目は西暦600年に境部臣を征討将軍に任命した。
sen.e: SAKAIBE no Omi was appointed general of the first Seitogun in 600 AD.
SAKAIBE no Omi was appointed general of the first Seitogun in 600.
SAKAIBE no Omi was appointed general of the first Seitogun in 600.

sen.j: ２度目は602年、聖徳太子の弟来目皇子を征討将軍として編成されたが、来目皇子の病死で中止された。
sen.e: The second Seitogun was organized by appointing MENO Miko, the younger brother of Prince Shotoku, general; however, the plan was called off due to the death of MENO Miko from an illness.

The second Seitogun was organized in 602 by appointing Prince Kume, the younger brother of Prince Shotoku, as the general of the Seitogun, however, the plan was called off due to the death of Prince Kume from illness.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。「602年」を補足し、用語集に合わせました。
sen.e: The second Seitogun was organized in 602 by appointing Prince Kume, the younger brother of Prince Shotoku, as the general of the Seitogun, however, the plan was called off due to the death of Prince Kume from illness.
